arrows.description: A classic - Made-in-the-USA. Shoot your broadhead with the precision-crafted XX75 accuracy. TECHNICAL DATA - Pre-installed UNI bushings - RPS inserts included - 7075-T9 alloy - Pre-installed Super Nocks or X-Nock - Tensile strength (psi): 96,000 - Straightness guarantee: ± .002"
High-quality carbon arrows with reduced diameter for greater penetration depth. TECHNICAL DATA - Pre-installed H-nocks - ST RPS 8-32 inserts - Straightness: ± .005" - High-strength carbon fibers

Traditionally since 1922. Doug Easton started it all; in his small shop in California, he crafted longbows, leather quivers, and cedar shafts. The XX75 Legacy was designed with Easton's early days in mind... Hats off to you, Doug. TECHNICAL DATA - 7075-T9 alloy - Conventional nocks - Integrated nock taper - Guaranteed straightness: ± .002". - RPS inserts included (fletched arrows include both nocks and inserts)

The Match Grade Version - The proven full-carbon arrow with a small diameter. Faster, farther, deadlier. TECHNICAL DATA - Pre-installed X nock - X HIT 8-32 inserts - Straightness: ± .001" - High-strength carbon composite fibers Brass X HIT® 8-32 Break-Off Insert & Deep Six thread RPS available separately

When it comes to the toughest animals in the world, I need the hardest-hitting arrow I can get. Dangerous Game gives me deep penetration for the heaviest, thickest-skinned animals on the planet. The combination of high strength and a high-load carbon core, wrapped in a fully reinforced metal jacket, provides the Dangerous Game with the full bone-breaking power I need for hunting worldwide." - Phil Phillips TECHNICAL DATA - High-strength N-FUSED® carbon core with 7075 metal alloy jacket - Guaranteed straightness: ± .002″ - Light target pull INCLUDED COMPONENTS: - Pre-installed orange X nocks - Conventional break-off brass X HIT inserts SEPARATELY SOLD COMPONENTS: - Conventional X HIT inserts - Deep Six6 RPS steel inserts - Deep Six6 broadheads - Field arrows

Enhance your hunting game with the new Pro-Version Enhanced F.O.C. arrows from Easton Archery. Factory-straight, high tolerances that are effective at high speeds. 6MM H-break-off brass inserts are included, allowing you to adjust the weight from 75 to 50 grains if needed for ideal Front-Of-Center weight and balance. TECHNICAL DATA - Pre-installed H-nocks - Lightweight high-speed carbon - Straightness: ± .001" - 8-32 brass inserts included

Improve your hunting game with the new Pro-Version F.O.C enhanced hunting arrows from Easton Archery. For fast and straight shooting—carbon fiber, perfect for you if you want speed. Bloodline F.O.C. is available in sizes 240, 330, and 400. TECHNICAL DATA - Includes brass 8-32 inserts. - Pre-installed H-nocks. - Straightness: ± .003". - High-strength carbon fiber.

The high-speed Superdrive 19, made from Easton's Superdrive carbon construction, offers archers a lightweight arrow choice with a smaller diameter, making it ideal for 3D competitions where wind could be a factor, as well as for field and outdoor target archery, making it a great all-purpose competition arrow for outdoor use. The Superdrive 19 features an adjustable stainless steel point system, allowing the archer to customize the weight from 90 to 200 grains with interchangeable weight modules. The Superdrive 19 is available in three spine variations and is suitable for most compound and recurve bow setups. The Superdrive 19 connects the Superdrive 23, 25, and 27 shafts, completing the full range of Easton carbon shafts.

Hunting accuracy for the archer was the focus in the development of the Easton 6.5 arrows. The 6.5 utilizes the proprietary Acu-Carbon™ Uniform Spine process. Acu-Carbon™ is a continuous feed manufacturing process that achieves the most reliable tolerances, eliminating the need for spine alignment and weight sorting. Easton's Acu-Carbon™ production line produces the most consistent spines and weights year after year, dozen after dozen. This benefits the bowhunter with more precise flight and higher target accuracy in the field. Easton, the leading name in archery since 1922, has announced the new 6.5 hunting arrow series, now available. The Easton 6.5MM™ arrows are USA-made shafts, offering bowhunters the highest level of precision available today—at prices that fit virtually any budget. The Easton 6.5 features NEW 6.5MM inserts, manufactured with a 4X larger shoulder to increase strength and enhance valuable FOC. The 6.5 will also include Microlite nocks, designed to bring the nock throat closer to the back of the arrow shaft. This simplifies the release and further optimizes shot precision. Microlite nocks are 38% lighter to increase arrow speed and shift weight forward, improving arrow flight. The Easton Carbon 6.5™ product line includes three base models: - Match Grade ±.001" - Hunter Classic ±.003" - Bowhunter ±.006" TECHNICAL INFORMATION - Acu-Carbon™ Uniform Spine USA – Manufacturing process for maximum precision. - Microlite Nocks – Shortens the critical distance between shaft and bowstring for better alignment and reduced weight. - 6.5MM Inserts – The precision-machined component features a four-times larger shoulder. Reinforces the broadhead/arrow interface and increases F.O.C. - Bully™ Vane Fletching – Stiffer material for superior control and quiet arrow flight. - Available in three models: Match Grade ±.001", Hunter Classic ±.003", and Bowhunter ±.006". - Spine sizes: 340, 400, 500

NEW Easton RX7 - The Ultimate Indoor Recurve Arrow Shaft Easton's exclusive Tapered Technology enables a larger line-catcher arrow with reduced bow and/or point weight. New for the 2020 indoor season, Easton announces the most precise, technically advanced indoor arrow shaft ever developed for recurve archers—the brand-new RX-7 series. Available in three spine values—525, 475, and 420—in diameters 21, 22, and World Archery Maximum 23. Easton's new RX-7 series 7178 aluminum arrow shafts feature a precision rear taper—allowing recurve archers to shoot a larger arrow with reduced bow weight and less point weight while maintaining maximum shaft diameter for higher scoring potential. The RX-7 proved itself during the 2018-19 competition season with some of the world's top archers, including Brady Ellison and Jack Williams of Team USA. It is based on the same proven design principle as Easton's X10 and A/C/E shafts, with a precise, flexible, forgiving rear taper. Williams said: "The RX-7's rear taper creates the most forgiving aluminum arrow for a recurve archer. It allows archers to use lighter point weights to achieve proper tuning, enabling faster releases and better arrow flight." This design element reduces the dynamic spine of the arrow shaft by up to a full size, allowing the use of a larger diameter and lighter point. Previously, many archers seeking maximum-diameter shafts often compromised bow tuning and potentially sacrificed shot-forgiveness by using super-heavy points, leading to greater error potential with slight release variations. By using a standard weight point and a precision-engineered, more flexible rear taper with a forward-weighted design, the RX-7 series shafts offer the ultimate shot-forgiveness. The RX-7 uses a solid 7178-T9 alloy that handles tough European target materials with ease. RX-7 shafts come with Easton Super-UNI bushings, accommodating available Easton Super Nocks, 3D Super Nocks, and the popular Beiter nock in size 19. The updated tuning chart for the RX-7 is available online at www.eastonarchery.com. RX-7 shafts are 100% made in the USA. A technical article detailing tuning techniques for the RX7 can be read at the link below. https://eastonarchery.com/2019/10/technical-guide-to-setting-up-the-easton-rx-7-arrow-shaft/

ABOUT THE PRODUCT Highest quality and top performance usually come with a corresponding price. Well, not anymore. The new A/C PROCOMP arrow from Easton is now available for Target and Field competitions. The lightweight, parallel PROCOMP with high speed and low weight is designed for archers looking to improve their scores in club-level competitions and Compound tournaments. The PROCOMP was proven in the 2018 season by world champions Steve Anderson and Braden Gellenthien on high-level tournament courses, earning five podium finishes in archery and another at the first event of the 2019 World Championship season. The 4MM PROCOMP features Easton's unmatched spine consistency and precise weight accuracy, utilizing our exclusive high-modulus carbon and super-strong alloy core construction. Compatible with most 4mm Easton components, including direct-mount G-nocks and DEEP-SIX nocks (recommended for high-energy compound nock systems). See the table below for details on compatible point and bolt nock systems. Available spine values: 300, 340, 380, 420, 470, 520, and 570. All PROCOMP shafts are delivered in a sealed 12-pack with a +/-1-grain weight tolerance per dozen. Straightness .0015" or better. MADE IN THE USA. Available in spine values: 300, 340, 380, 420, 470, 520, and 570.

New 5MM Axis SPT Carbon arrows with high penetration for bows with shorter draw/lower weight. Easton's Axis SPT is the newest member of the legendary AXIS series, offering improved field performance for bowhunters with shorter draws and/or lighter arrow setups. The SPT is available in three spine values (500, 600, and 700) and provides exceptional value for money. The Axis SPT hunting arrows with a micro-diameter of 5 mm are compatible with all Axis accessory components, including the highly sought-after FOC-enhancing Easton brass inserts, and now they're more affordable than ever. TECHNICAL DATA - Pre-installed X-Nock - X HIT 8-32 Inserts - Straightness: ± .006" - High-strength carbon composite fibers

Easton's new Hyperspeed and Hyperspeed Pro 3D arrows are all-around performers for compound target and 3D shooting. These 6.5MM 3D carbon arrows combine speed performance with the unmatched precision and durability of Easton's Made in USA carbon technology. The Hyperspeed is available in the most popular performance spine ratings from 300 to 500. The Hyperspeed Pro is offered in precision straightness with a straightness tolerance of one-thousandth of an inch and is only available through authorized Easton dealers with full service. TECHNICAL DATA - Standard diameter penetration. - Long-lasting carbon fiber durability. - High-strength carbon fibers with a standard diameter of 6.5MM. - Pre-installed 6.5MM Microlite™ Super Nocks. - CB RPS 8-32 inserts. - Straightness: ±.003" (PRO ±.001"). - The Hyperspeed Pro is only available through authorized Easton full-service dealers.

Precision and performance for higher scores. Suitable for all forms of archery outdoors and indoors, the A/C/G is the "do it all" shaft. All Easton A/C/G (A/C Gold) shafts have the same 4 mm inner diameter for precise component selection. The aluminum core, wrapped with specially reinforced carbon fiber, creates a more durable, easily tunable arrow that is a true all-rounder for both compound and recurve competitive archers seeking top performance in any form of target archery. Easton's unmatched spine and weight standards make the A/C/G one of the most precise arrows in any price range. Every A/C/G is manufactured by Easton in the USA. TECHNICAL DATA - Lightweight carbon fiber bonded with a 7075 aluminum core - Straightness ± .002″ - Weight tolerance: ± 1.0 grains - Components sold separately - Parallel shape - MADE IN USA

Easton's A/C/C (Aluminum Carbon Competition) has become legendary as the do-it-all arrow for every type of archery. With its advanced aluminum-carbon construction, available in sizes to fit every archer, and a selection of components to fulfill every bow mission, the A/C/C truly is the "Swiss Army knife of arrows." Want to win a FITA round with a compound, a 3D event with a barebow, or shoot precise indoor rounds with an Olympic recurve using the same arrow? Then the A/C/C is perfect for you. With unmatched precision, extreme spine consistency, and unparalleled versatility, the A/C/C is the arrow for everything. Every A/C/C is proudly made in the USA by Easton. TECHNICAL DATA - High-strength carbon fiber bonded to a precision 7075 aluminum core - Polished carbon surface - Straightness: ± .002" - Weight tolerance: ± 0.5 grains - Components sold separately - Nock bushing installed (except -00 sizes) - Parallel shape - MADE IN USA

Easton's A/C/C (Aluminum Carbon Competition) has become legendary as the do-it-all arrow for every type of archery. With its advanced aluminum-carbon construction, available in sizes to fit every archer, and a selection of components to fulfill every bow mission, the A/C/C truly is the "Swiss Army knife of arrows." Want to win a FITA round with a compound, a 3D event with a barebow, or shoot precise indoor rounds with an Olympic recurve using the same arrow? Then the A/C/C is perfect for you. With unmatched precision, extreme spine consistency, and unparalleled versatility, the A/C/C is the arrow for everything. Every A/C/C is proudly made in the USA by Easton. TECHNICAL DATA - High-strength carbon fiber bonded to a precision 7075 aluminum core - Polished carbon surface - Straightness: ± .002" - Weight tolerance: ± 0.5 grains - Components sold separately - Nock bushing installed (except -00 sizes) - Parallel shape - MADE IN USA

The FMJ Match is a high-performance, high-strength Full Metal Jacket Target Carbon shaft for tournament compound and recurve archers. It delivers superior kinetic energy, better precision at long distances, and increased durability against hard target impacts. Made from a high-strength aluminum jacket (7075 alloy) over a high-stiffness carbon core for ultimate consistency through the combination of both materials. Each FMJ is manufactured by Easton in the USA. TECHNICAL DATA - Reduced 4MM (G) diameter for optimal outdoor performance - Compatible with existing Easton Carbon One components - Diamond-ground 7075 aluminum jacket - Factory-straightened, weight and spine matched - Straightness guarantee: ± .001″ - Weight tolerance: ± 2.0 grains - Components sold separately - Complies with World Archery regulations - MADE IN USA

Apollo is the full-carbon beginner arrow with the tolerances and spine sizes required to ensure proper tuning for every archer. TECHNICAL DATA - Smooth machined surface - Straightness: ± .005″ - Weight tolerance: ± 2.0 grains - Components sold separately - Parallel shape - All sizes use Pin Nock, G-Pin Nock, and G-Nock - Points included

The X7 Eclipse arrow shaft is the world standard for precision and perfect tuning. Precise spine, balanced weight, and incredible straightness. TECHNICAL DATA - 7178-T9 aerospace alloy - Hard anodized black finish - Straightness: ± .001" - Weight tolerance: ± 0.75% - Strength (psi): 105,000 - G-UNI/Super UNI bushing installed - Nocks and points sold separately - Sizes 1514 to 2214 are suitable for World Archery MADE IN USA

Durable, precise, and affordable—the XX75 Tribute is the perfect introduction to the world of professional shafts for all archers and beginners with short draws or lighter bows. TECHNICAL DATA - 7075 aerospace-grade alloy - Hard-anodized black finish - Guaranteed straightness: ± .005″ - Weight tolerance: ± 2% - Strength (psi): 90,000 - Precision-ground nock taper - Components sold separately - Sizes: 1214, 1413, 1416, 1516, 1616, 1716, 1816, 1916, 2016 1214 size uses the direct-fit G-nock

The Jazz offers all the accuracy benefits of the XX75 alloy and is available in sizes up to 1214 to equip every beginning archer. TECHNICAL DATA - 7075 aerospace alloy - Hard-anodized black finish - Guaranteed straightness: ± .005″ - Weight tolerance: ± 2% - Strength (psi): 90,000 - Precision-ground nock taper - Separately sold components - Sizes: 1214, 1413, 1416, 1516, 1616, 1716, 1816, 1916, 2016 1214 size uses the direct-fit G-nock

The only arrow approved for NASP tournament competition. Precise, durable, and economical. TECHNICAL DATA - 7075 aerospace alloy - Hard anodized - Straightness: ± .005″ - Weight tolerance: ± 2.5% - Strength (psi): 90,000 - UNI-bushing installed - The ONLY arrow approved for all NASP tournaments and events - Available in black, violet, blue, and green MADE IN USA

The Inspiré is a carbon shaft manufactured according to Easton quality standards, offering a wide range of spines for beginners of all ages. TECHNICAL DATA - Small diameter, micro-smooth carbon surface - Available in ten sizes - One-piece points in factory-mounted shafts - Parallel shape

The ultimate recurve competition shaft. The Easton X10 has won more world and Olympic titles since its competition debut at the 1996 Olympics in Atlanta, USA, than any other arrow or archery product of any kind. Since its gold medal debut, it has won every single Olympic medal at the Atlanta Games. High-modulus carbon fiber on a precise, thin aluminum core creates an unmatched balance of precision and durability. With components tuned to the performance of this ultimate target shaft, every size of the X10 features a specially developed taper design, ultimate forgiveness, release error forgiveness, and the right frequency tuning for modern recurve bows. X10. No other shaft comes close. Made by Easton in the USA. TECHNICAL DATA - High-strength carbon fiber bonded to a 7075 precision alloy core - Polished 9-micron carbon surface - Straightness: ± .0015" - Weight tolerance: ± 0.5 grains per packaged dozen - Weight coded for precision matching between dozens - Components sold separately - Barreled form - Has won every Olympic title since 1996 MADE IN USA

Since its introduction, the compound-specific X10 Protour has won more titles and set more records for compound archers than all other models combined. The Protour was specifically developed for compound target competitions and features a front taper that allows the use of Easton X10 point components in any size—the same components with which every Olympic medal has been won since 1996. The precisely engineered weight-to-spine ratio of each Procomp size ensures the best ballistic performance at longer distances in compound-based competitions, giving archers an undeniable advantage in unpredictable, windy conditions. With unmatched precision and legendary durability, even against the toughest target materials in the world, Procomp is the absolute pinnacle of performance for compound target precision. Every Procomp arrow is manufactured by Easton in the USA. TECHNICAL DATA - Lightweight, high-modulus carbon fiber bonded with a precision 7075 alloy core - Polished black carbon surface - Straightness ± .0015″ - Weight tolerance: ± 0.5 grains - Components sold separately - Tapered form MADE IN USA

Platinum Plus is a premium shaft in the mid-price range for all levels of recreational and competitive archery. TECHNICAL DATA - 7075-T9 aerospace alloy - Hard anodized surface - Guaranteed straightness: ± .002″ - Weight tolerance: ± 1% - Strength (psi): 96,000 - Super or G UNI bushing installed - Components sold separately Sizes: 1416, 1516, 1616, 1713, 1716, 1813, 1816, 1913, 1916, 2013, 2016, 2114, 2213, 2315

The legendary quality of the 7075 alloy and a durable size of 1618 make the Neos the ideal arrow for recreational and beginner archers shooting with lighter bows. TECHNICAL DATA - 7075 aerospace alloy - Hard-anodized gold finish - Guaranteed straightness: ± .008″ - Weight tolerance: ± 5% - Precision-ground nock taper - Size 1618 - Components sold separately

Get the reliability of the XX75 series in a crossbow bolt. TECHNICAL DATA - Hardlox finish - Flatback or half-moon nocks - Tensile strength (psi): 96,000 - 7075-T9 alloy - Available in two lengths: 20", 22"

Easton's new Avance and Avance Sport 4MM arrows are full-carbon target arrows. Avance and Avance Sport share the same carbon construction and are then sorted by straightness. The Avance has a straightness of +/- 0.003", ideal for mid-level archers; and the Avance Sport features a straightness specification of +/- 0.006", ideal for inexperienced archers seeking light performance in a less expensive arrow. The Avance series is available in a wide range of spine sizes, covering the tuning range for recurve and compound archers across a broad spectrum of bow types, draw lengths, and poundages. The durable full-carbon construction of the Avance nets a lighter arrow than previous Easton offerings, enabling top-tier performance and providing significant advantages for beginner to mid-level target archers. Features: - 4MM full-carbon target arrows - Avance +/- .003" straightness; Avance Sport +/-.006" straightness - Lighter weight than arrows from earlier categories (Carbon One and Apollo) - Available in 16 spines from 340-2000

The Easton Carbon Legacy combines the traditional look of wood-grained carbon with highly visible, white-dipped, and hand-fletched craftsmanship. This arrow offers the finest vintage aesthetic in a highly effective hunting carbon arrow. Fletched with three 4" left-wing helical feathers, including a traditional barred index feather and combinations of red, white, and bright yellow hen feathers. The Carbon Legacy is precise, durable, and offers exceptional visibility in flight. Technical Specifications: - Pre-assembled with 6.5MM 3D Super Nocks and aluminum inserts - Available in 340, 400, 500, 600, and 700 spines - Crafted from premium carbon fiber, the Legacy pays tribute to the history of our sport with a realistic wood-grain finish, a white-crowned nock end, and helical fletching. - .244" ID standard diameter carbon fiber construction - Pre-installed white 3D Super Nocks - Includes RPS aluminum inserts - Straightness ±.006" - 4" left-wing helical fletched with feathers

Easton's 6.5MM Whiteout is the next evolution in hunting arrow aesthetics. With a completely white exterior finish and a uniform ACU-carbon construction made in the USA, the Whiteout offers high visibility in flight and features a blood indicator for shot placement identification. Technical specs: - Highly visible arrow for quick shot identification - +/- .003" straightness - Available in 300-500 spines - Available by the dozen in bare shafts - Made in the USA with the Easton Acu-Carbon™ process

The high-performance Easton A/C PROCOMP, renowned for podium finishes in professional tournaments worldwide, has now been optimized for field and hunting use in the new PROCOMP Hunting Series. The PROCOMP delivers a higher level of precision and better tuning in a high-performance target shaft. Based on Easton's patented 4MM Parallel Shaft profile with micro-diameter, the PROCOMP is an ideal solution for competitive target and field archers demanding high performance standards at an affordable price. The new Pro Comp Hunting Series will be available in sizes 380, 340, 300, and NEW 250, and comes with 8-32 aluminum half-outserts and 4mm deep six-nock collars. An optional titanium 8-32 half-out is also available separately. The Pro Comp arrows are ultra-lightweight, built on the proven 7075 aluminum core and fused with a high-strength, high-modulus carbon shell. With its precise straightness tolerance of ±.0015" and minimal weight variation of +/- 0.5 grains, the Pro Comp delivers the trusted, predictable performance demanded by the world's top archers—now available to all field archers and bowhunters. The USA-made Pro Comp shafts feature a matte black, low-glare carbon surface for easy fletching.

Easton unveiled a new lightweight arrow in its 6.5 mm product line—the 6.5 MATRIX. This new arrow is an ultralight model that uses Easton's seamless Acu-carbon™ process. Additionally, the Matrix features a new carbon fiber weave visible on the exterior of the shaft. Easton's patented process results in a seamless shaft that delivers nearly perfect spine and weight with every production run. Without the inconsistency in weight and spine found in traditional arrow manufacturing methods, arrows made from Acu-carbon are easier to tune and offer better accuracy on the range and in the field.

The industry-leading Carbon AXIS is now available in a 4MM micro-diameter. The AXIS 4MM Long Range has been developed with a specialized 100% carbon fiber layup for increased speed. It features Easton's new aluminum point outsert to enhance both strength and accuracy at long distances and comes with pre-installed 4MM nocks. Technical Data: - Micro-diameter, 100% carbon hunting arrow - increased speed - Reduced friction in flight and upon impact for optimized FOC, improved target penetration, and better long-range accuracy - 4 popular hunting spine sizes - 250, 300, 340, and 400 - Includes NEW aluminum points; 4MM nocks pre-installed - Shipped in dozens of bare shafts - Made in the USA - Straightness: +/- .003″ [Match Grade: +/- .001″]

The 4MM FMJ delivers the highest penetration power and is precision-manufactured in the USA for the most accurate hunting arrow on the market. The 4MM Full Metal Jacket has been updated with a new spine configuration, a completely redesigned 8-32 point outsert system, and new graphics. The standard 8-32 threaded point outsert optimizes the front-of-center for easier arrow tuning and increased durability. FMJ starts with an advanced carbon core for lightweight strength. A full metal jacket adds kinetic energy, improves accuracy, and makes extraction from the target easier. The combination ensures deep penetration and more pass-throughs for quicker kills and stronger blood trails. Technical specifications: - 4mm micro-diameter carbon core with 7075 alloy jacket - Easy target extraction - Straightness +/- .003" (also available in .001" Match Grade version) - Made in the USA
